Overview: A stagecoach is plagued by robberies, but it takes an undercover Wells Fargo agent to discover that a rival company is responsible.

Title: Lizzie
Tagline: Which girl was she?
Overview: A psychiatrist (Richard Boone) treats a woman (Eleanor Parker) of three faces: neurotic Elizabeth, wanton Lizzie, charming Beth.

Title: Lust of the Vampire
Overview: A mad scientist captures young women and drains their blood, in order to keep alive an ancient, evil duchess.

Title: The Strange One
Tagline: "THE STRANGE ONE" IS A STRANGE ONE!
Overview: A military school student develops a destructive power over his fellow cadets.

Title: Seven Waves Away
Tagline: 14 of these survivors must be cast adrift! Which will the Captain choose?
Overview: Ship's officer finds himself in command of a lifeboat full of survivors of a sunken luxury liner.

Title: The Spirit of St. Louis
Tagline: One of the Great Advnetures of Our Time !
Overview: Charles 'Slim' Lindbergh struggles to finance and design an airplane that will make his New York to Paris flight the first solo transatlantic crossing.

Title: Tokyo Twilight
Overview: Two sisters find out the existence of their long-lost mother, but the younger cannot take the truth of being abandoned as a child.

Title: The Severed Heads
Overview: A short mime adaptation of a Thomas Mann story about a Parisian urchin who makes her living selling human heads. Lost for nearly 50 years, the movie was found in 2006 by the son of Ruth Michelly and Saul Gilbert when he found it in his mom's attic in Munich.

Title: Shoot-Out At Medicine Bend
Tagline: He called himself the "Preacher"... and he wrote his sermons in lead!
Overview: Director Richard L. Bare's 1957 revenge western stars Randolph Scott as an army veteran seeking the men who sold defective ammunition that caused his brother's death.

Title: Designing Woman
Tagline: His world is guys and dolls! Her world is gowns and glamor!
Overview: A sportswriter who marries a fashion designer discovers that their mutual interests are few, although each has an intriguing past which makes the other jealous.

Title: The Weapon
Overview: A boy accidentally shoots a friend with a gun he found in the rubble of a destroyed building. The gun turns out to be a clue in a ten-year-old murder case.

Title: The Monster that Challenged the World
Tagline: A new kind of terror to numb the nerves!
Overview: Giants Mollusks are released from the earth by an earthquake and start killing people.
Original Title: The Monster that Challenged the World

Title: Bayou
Tagline: Somewhere, a 15-year old girl may be a teenager... in the Cajun country, she's a woman full-grown! ...and every Bayou man knows it!
Overview: A community of Cajun fishermen living around a remote bayou includes one authentic beauty, Marie, who wants to better herself but must deal with the unwelcome attentions of storekeeper Ulysses. When she meets Martin Davis, visiting New York architect, they hit it off at once; but the sinister Ulysses is not inclined to suffer a Yankee rival.

Title: The Giant Claw
Tagline: Flying beast out of prehistoric skies!
Overview: Global panic ensues when it is revealed that a mysterious UFO is actually a giant turkey-like bird that flies at supersonic speed and has no regard for life or architecture.

Title: I Was a Teenage Werewolf
Tagline: Explosive! Amazing! Terrifying! You won't believe your eyes!
Overview: A meat-eating teenager (Michael Landon) sees a psychiatrist (Whit Bissell), who only makes things worse.

Title: The Happy Road
Tagline: It Happened On... The Happy Road
Overview: Two children run away from a Swiss boarding school and set out for Paris, with their frantic parents in hot pursuit. Gene Kelly directed and stars in this 1957 comedy, with other roles played by Barbara Laage, Bobby Clark, Brigitte Fossey and Michael Redgrave.

Title: The Lonely Man
Tagline: Two of today's most publicized personalities Anthony Perkins and Jack Palance teamed in a great outdoor drama!
Overview: Aging gunslinger Jacob Wade hopes to settle down with his estranged son, but his old enemies have other plans for him. Gunslinger Jacob Wade finds his long-abandoned son Riley, now a young man who hates his father but has nowhere else to go. Hoping to settle down, Jacob finds no town will have him. They end at Monolith, the ranch of Jacob's former girlfriend Ada, to whom he had no intention of returning. A mustang hunt finds Riley himself attracted to the shapely Ada...and Jacob having trouble with his eyesight. And his visions of a quiet life are doomed by the re-appearance of enemies from his past...

Title: Il Grido
Overview: A sugar-refinery worker (Steve Cochran) flees his Northern Italy town after a woman (Alida Valli) refuses his marriage proposal.

Title: Daughter of Dr. Jekyll
Tagline: Blood-hungry spawn of the world's most bestial fiend!
Overview: A young woman discovers she is the daughter of the infamous Dr. Jekyll, and begins to believe that she may also have a split personality, one of whom is a ruthless killer.

Title: Le Notti Bianche
Overview: A lonely clerk attempts to win the love of a woman who still awaits the return of her long-absent suitor.

Title: What's Opera, Doc?
Overview: Bugs is in drag as the Valkyrie Brunhilde who sits on an overwieght horse. "She" is pursued by Elmer playing the demigod "Siegfried".

Title: The Shiralee
Overview: An Australian "swagman" finds his wife with another man, so he takes the daughter, Buster, with him. On the road together, going from town to town and from farm to farm, father and daughter explore new depths of understanding and bonding.

Title: Lady of Vengeance
Tagline: A shocking woman... a shocker of a story!
Overview: A powerful newspaper publisher (Dennis O'Keefe) plots what he believes is  the "perfect murder". Director Burt Balaban's 1957 British film also stars Anton  Diffring, Ann Sears, Vernon Greeves and Eileen Elton.

Title: Edge of the City
Tagline: Tense drama of frightened men!
Overview: An army deserter and a black dock worker join forces against a corrupt union official.

Title: Band of Angels
Tagline: You're no blue blood any more, honey. The master bought you...and now he's waitin'!
Overview: Living in Kentucky prior to the Civil War, Amantha Starr is a privileged young woman. Her widower father, a wealthy plantation owner, dotes on her and he sends her to the best schools. When he dies suddenly however, Amantha's world is turned upside down. She learns that her father had been living on borrowed money and that her mother was actually a slave and her father's mistress. The plantation is to be sold to pay off her father's debts and as the daughter of slave, Amatha is also to be sold as property. She is bought by a Louisiana plantation owner, Hamish Bond and over time she grows to love him until she learns he was a slave-trader. She tries again to become part of white society but realizes that her future lies elsewhere.

Title: Across the Bridge
Overview: In Mexico, a financier on the run poses as a man he just murdered, only to find out that the man was also a murderer.

Title: The Disembodied
Tagline: FEMALE WITCH DOCTOR...FIENDISH TIGRESS OF THE JUNGLE!
Overview: When men on a photo safari stumble into a misanthropic doctor’s remote camp with a wounded comrade, the doctor's restless wife supplements her usual pursuit (voodoo, especially as a way to off her husband) with a new one: seduction. As men lose their hearts (sometimes literally) to the alluring voodoo priestess, she embarks on a killing spree that turns the jungle blood red.

Title: Un marido de ida y vuelta
Overview: Adaptation of the eponymous play of Jardiel Poncela. A husband dominated by his overbearing wife dies victim of a heart attack the day she forces him to shave his beloved beard to go to a costume ball dressed as a bullfighter. Its spectrum then begins to walk around the house and the most unexpected cause tangles. When she finally decides to settle definitely get materialize and get his wife, who has meanwhile become a being sweet and understanding.
Original Title: Un marido de ida y vuelta

Title: The Abominable Snowman
Tagline: See It With Someone Brave! -- A Timeless Terror to Freeze You to Your Seats!
Overview: A kindly English botanist and a gruff American promoter lead an expedition to the Himalayas in search of the legendary Yeti.

Title: Run of the Arrow
Tagline: The strange saga of the Johnny Reb who turned Sioux to wage a one-man war against the Yankees !
Overview: A veteran leaves the army, and finds a home with the Sioux.

Title: House of Numbers
Tagline: Actually filmed in SAN QUENTIN
Overview: Palance plays twin brothers - one trying to help another escape from prison.

Title: Paths of Glory
Tagline: It explodes in the no-man's land no picture ever dared cross before!
Overview: During World War I, commanding officer General Broulard (Adolphe Menjou) orders his subordinate, General Mireau (George Macready), to attack a German trench position, offering a promotion as an incentive. Though the mission is foolhardy to the point of suicide, Mireau commands his own subordinate, Colonel Dax (Kirk Douglas), to plan the attack. When it ends in disaster, General Mireau demands the court-martial of three random soldiers in order to save face.

Title: The Devil Strikes at Night
Overview: A serial killer terrorizes Hamburg, Germany, during World War II. When the local police can't seem to catch him, the SS is brought into the case.

Title: The Girl in Black Stockings
Tagline: She's every inch a teasing, taunting "Come-on" Blonde.
Overview: A young girl's murder leaves a hotel full of suspects.

Title: Domino Kid
Tagline: Go...For...Your Gun Domino!
Overview: A rancher vows revenge on the five men responsible for his father's death.

Title: Affair in Havana
Overview: While in Havana, a musician gets involved with a crippled man and his beautiful wife... with deadly results.

Title: The Vampire
Overview: A pretty young Mexican girl returns to her hometown to make funeral arrangements for her beloved aunt, who has just died. Soon she begins to hear disturbing stories about the town being infested by vampires, and she eventually begins to suspect that her remaining aunt and the mysterious next-door neighbor may be involved.

Title: The Blue Sky Maiden
Overview: Yuko is sent to the coastal regions to be raised away from the rest of her sophisticated family where she finds out from her ill grandmother that she is not who she thought she was.

Title: Until They Sail
Tagline: They couldn't have the love they wanted, so they took the love they could get!
Overview: Four sisters in New Zealand fall for four U.S. soldiers en route to the Pacific theater in WWII.

Title: The Black Scorpion
Tagline: Every horror you've seen on the screen grows pale beside the horror of
Overview: Giant scorpions wreck havoc after being released due to volcanic activity

Title: A Face in the Crowd
Tagline: POWER! He loved it! He took it raw in big gulpfuls...he liked the taste, the way it mixed with the bourbon and the sin in his blood!
Overview: "A Face in the Crowd" charts the rise of a raucous hayseed named Lonesome Rhodes from itinerant Ozark guitar picker to local media rabble-rouser to TV superstar and political king-maker. Marcia Jeffries is the innocent Sarah Lawrence girl who discovers the great man in a back-country jail and is the first to fall under his spell

Title: Black River
Overview: The story follows a university student who moves into an apartment building and becomes involved with a waitress. The landlord then attempts to evict the tenants and sell the building through illicit means.

Title: The Tin Star
Tagline: For $40 a month and a shiny Tin Star...the young sheriff faced the mob alone...except for the angry ex-sheriff who couldn't watch him die and a hero-worshipping boy who lived only for the day he'd wear a TIn Star of his own!
Overview: An experienced bounty hunter helps a young sheriff learn the meaning of his badge.

Title: A King in New York
Tagline: The king of comedians!
Overview: Due to a revolution in his country, King Shahdov comes to New York - almost broke. To get some money he goes to TV, making commercials and meets the child from communist parents. Due to this he is suddenly a suspected as a communist himself and has to face one of McCarthy's hearings.

Title: The Amazing Colossal Man
Tagline: Growing...! Growing...! Growing...! To a Giant! to a Monster! When will it stop?
Overview: Lt. Col. Glenn Manning is inadvertently exposed to a plutonium bomb blast and although he sustains burns over 90% of his body, he survives. Then he begins to grow, but as he grows he starts losing his mind. By the time he stops he is 50 ft tall, insane and is on the rampage.

Title: The Story of Mankind
Tagline: Explorer... Warrior... Dreamer!
Overview: The Spirit of Man (Ronald Colman) debates history with the devil (Vincent Price) before a court of fate, because of the hydrogen bomb.

Title: Jailhouse Rock
Tagline: Elvis in Action as Never Before!
Overview: After serving time for manslaughter, young Vince Everett becomes a teenage rock star.

Title: Nine Lives
Overview: The movie takes place during World War II and depicts the true story of Jan Baalsruds amazing escape from the German army from the coast of Northern Norway and across the border to the neutral country Sweden.
Original Title: Ni liv: Historien om Jan Baalsrud

Title: The Tarnished Angels
Tagline: The Book They Said Could Never Be Filmed!
Overview: Story of a friendship between an eccentric journalist and a daredevil barnstorming pilot.

Title: The Hard Man
Tagline: He's Got the Southwest...Over a Gun-Barrel!
Overview: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

Title: The Naked Truth
Tagline: The screamingly funny comedy team!
Overview: Nigel Dennis publishes a scandal magazine. But for each story he writes, he first approaches the person whose scandalous behavior is described (or rather implied, to avoid any libel suit) and says he will suppress the story in return for money. Several of his victims first decide individually to kill him instead of paying, but fail in amusing ways. Then they find that to protect their various secrets they must now join forces for a rather different purpose...

Title: Baby Face Nelson
Tagline: the baby-face punk who became the FBI's PUBLIC ENEMY NO. 1!
Overview: Famed Depression-era gangster “Baby Face Nelson” (Mickey Rooney) robs and kills while accompanied by his beautiful moll (Carolyn Jones).

Title: Don't Go Near the Water
Tagline: THE LAUGH OF YOUR LIFE-TIME!
Overview: Madison Avenue-trained Navy men (Glenn Ford, Fred Clark) handle public relations on a South Pacific island during World War II.

Title: The Auntie from Chicago
Overview: Aunt Calliopi returns to Greece from Chicago after 30 years and plans to marry off her nieces.

Title: Sissi: The Fateful Years of an Empress
Overview: After a wonderful time in Hungary Sissi falls extremely ill and must retreat to a Mediterranean climate to rest. The young empress’ mother takes her from Austria to recover in Madeira.

Title: Raintree County
Tagline: In The Great Tradition Of Civil War Romance
Overview: A graduating poet/teacher falls in love with a Southern woman, and then the Civil War and her past create problems.

Title: The Dead Talk Back
Overview: A psychic researcher attempts to solve a murder by using a radio that enables him to speak with the dead.

Title: A Chairy Tale
Overview: An ordinary looking chair refuses to be sat upon.

Title: Le bel indifférent
Overview: An adaptation of Jean Cocteau's play of a woman lecturing her indifferent lover.

Title: The Screaming Skull
Tagline: The tortured ghost who claims vengeance in the bride's bedroom!
Overview: Newlyweds Eric and Jenni Whitlock retire to his desolate mansion, where Eric's first wife Marianne died from a mysterious freak accident. Jenni, who has a history of mental illness, begins to see strange things including a mysterious skull, which may or may not be a product of her imagination.

Title: Along the Coast
Tagline: A humorous travelogue of the French Riviera.
Overview: Tongue-in-cheek look at the French Riviera, especially in summer when it overflows with tourists. Reviews its history and famous visitors; displays its faux-exotic buildings, its crowded beaches, its trees and monuments; and, pokes fun at the colors women wear and the vagaries of fashion. The film celebrates the use of "Eden" as a place name, suggesting that paradise comes to the coast after all are gone, perhaps only on a remote island beach.

Title: The Rise and Fall of a Jungle Giant
Overview: A behind-the-scenes look at the building of the bridge in the film The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957) and the preparations for its destruction.
Original Title: The Rise and Fall of a Jungle Giant

Title: The Tender Game
Overview: Inspired by the song Tenderly Jack Lawrence and Walter Gross, a tender animation on a florist and a sweeper that she falls madly in love.

Title: We Have Only One Life
Overview: A bank teller discovers an accounting error, becomes rich and lives his life like he's never lived it.

Title: No Time For Sergeants
Overview: Georgia farm boy Will Stockdale is about to bust with pride. He’s been drafted. Will’s ready. But is Uncle Sam ready for Will? In No Time for Sergeants, Andy Griffith is certifiably funny in the role that clinched his stardom. Wearing a friendly, wide grin, he ambles into the U.S. Air Force – and lots of folks’ll never be the same.

Title: The Gypsy and the Gentleman
Overview: About to enter a marriage he wants no part of, rich nobleman Mitchell takes up with gypsy Mecouri. They marry, but she soon discovers he's deeply in debt. (TCM)

Title: Maigret Lays a Trap
Overview: Four women were murdered, each was knifed and, though they had their clothes torn, they weren't molested. As the famed police inspector Jules Maigret pieces the clues together, he comes to realize that for the elusive man that he suspects to be unmasked, he has to set him a trap.

Title: Kommunist
Overview: Drama set to the Russian civil war of 1918

Title: The Black Orchid
Tagline: More than a story of love... a story of life!
Overview: An aging widower fights family disapproval when he falls in love with a gangster's widow.

Title: Cowboy
Tagline: THE REAL, TRUE STORY OF THE WEST!
Overview: Chicago hotel clerk Frank Harris dreams of life as a cowboy, and he gets his chance when, jilted by the father of the woman he loves, he joins Tom Reece and his cattle-driving outfit. Soon, though, the tenderfoot finds out life on the range is neither what he expected nor what he's been looking for...

Title: Daddy-O
Tagline: Alive!! With the Beat and the Heat of Today's Rock-N-Roll Generation!
Overview: Phil, a part-time truck driver and singer who wears his pants far too high, meets a feisty platinum blonde who challenges him to a drag race through Griffith Park. When he is caught and loses his license, he meets up with the sketchy Frank Wooster who offers him a job singing in his new nightclub. When Phil discovers that his new job also includes drug running, he must fight to save his friends and himself.

Title: Cole Younger, Gunfighter
Tagline: ROWDIEST, LUSTIEST AFFAIR EVER SEEN!
Overview: An outlaw must decide whether to stick his neck out for an innocent man.

Title: Brink of Life
Overview: Set in a hospital where three women meet either because they have been through an abortion or are due to give birth.

Title: The Long, Hot Summer
Tagline: The red-hot lowdown on a southern family...that people talked about in whispers!
Overview: Ben Quick arrives in Frenchman's Bend, MS after being kicked out of another town for allegedly burning a barn for revenge. Will Varner owns just about everything in Frenchman's Bend and he hires Ben to work in his store. Will thinks his own son, Jody, who manages the store, lacks ambition and despairs of him getting his wife, Eula, pregnant. Will thinks his daughter, Clara, a schoolteacher, will never get married. He decides that Ben Quick might make a good husband for Clara to bring some new blood into the family

Title: The Night Heaven Fell
Tagline: The Hottest Exposure Since Man Created Film!
Overview: Ursula, a young, sensuous French girl, arrives in a Spanish mountain community to visit her aunt and uncle.  It isn't long before her uncle is killed by handsome stranger Lamberto and against her better judgement, Ursula falls in love with the killer...
Original Title: Les bijoutiers du clair de lune

Title: The Astounding She-Monster
Tagline: A creature from beyond the stars. EVIL... BEAUTIFUL... DEADLY...!
Overview: When a meteor crashes to earth, out of it emerges a glowing, female creature who terrorizes a group of people living in the California mountains.

Title: Touch of Evil
Tagline: THE STRANGEST VENGEANCE EVER PLANNED!
Overview: Stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in Mexican border town.

Title: Quantrill's Raiders
Tagline: The Hell-Horde they called The Butcher's Battalion!
Overview: A Civil War guerilla gang plans an attack on a Kansas arsenal.

Title: Machine-Gun Kelly
Tagline: Without His Gun He Was Naked Yellow!
Overview: Machine-Gun Kelly, the famous bank robber, seldom without his Thompson machine gun.

Title: The Left Handed Gun
Tagline: I don't run. I don't hide. I go where I want. I do what I want.
Overview: When a crooked sheriff murder his employer, William "Billy the Kid" Bonney decides to avenge the death by killing the man responsible, throwing the lives of everyone around him into turmoil, and endangering the General Amnesty set up by Governor Wallace to bring peace to the New Mexico Territory.

Title: The Last Inch
Overview: A pilot and his twelve years old sun are going to shoot an underwater pictures but suddenly get into big troubles.

Title: The Space Children
Overview: A glowing brain-like creature arrives on a beach near a rocket test site via a teleportation beam. The alien communicates telepathically with the children of scientists. The kids start doing the alien's bidding as the adults try to find out what's happening to their unruly offspring.

Title: War of the Colossal Beast
Tagline: The towering terror from hell!
Overview: Glenn Manning, "The Amazing Colosasal Man," believed dead after falling from the Hoover Dam, reemerges in rural Mexico, brain damaged, disfigured, and very angry.

Title: The Beast with a Million Eyes
Tagline: An unspeakable horror... Destroying... Terrifying!
Overview: An alien space craft lands in the desert. The alien takes over the minds of some of the local humans and animals and is able to see through them. The animals attack and the terror begins.
Original Title: The Beast with a Million Eyes

Title: The H-Man
Tagline: ALL H- BREAKS LOOSE!
Overview: Fallout from hydrogen bomb tests is turning people into blobs of oozing, radioactive green goop that travel through sewers and have a taste for human flesh, in "The H-Man" (1958). Kenji Sahara, Akihiko Hirata star.

Title: The Goddess
Tagline: Profound and astounding
Overview: Booze, pills and loneliness mark a young actress' rise to stardom.

Title: I Bury the Living
Tagline: Out of a Time-Rotted Tomb Crawls an Unspeakable Horror!
Overview: A newly appointed cemetery chairman discovers that, merely by inserting a black pin into a wall-sized map of the cemetery, he can cause the deaths of that plot's owner

Title: How to Make a Monster
Tagline: See the Ghastly Ghouls in Flaming Color!
Overview: When master monster make-up man Pete Dumond is fired by the new bosses of American International studios, he uses his creations to exact revenge.

Title: Gunman's Walk
Tagline: BLISTERING RAW DRAMA!
Overview: Tab Hunter plays Ed Hackett, the son of gunslinger-turned-land baron Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) in this wide-screen western.

Title: Welcome to Norway
Overview: A couple decide to open a home for refuges in the remote cold mountains of Norway.

Title: Mädchen in Uniform
Overview: After the death of her parents young girl Manuela von Meinhardis is sent to a boarding school where Prussian drill rules the education. Desperately seeking love and warmth in Manuela's heart special emotions for the only human lady teacher, Fraeulein von Bernburg, start growing. Manuela falls in love with her. It's just a matter of time until that forbidden love becomes known what immediately leads to disaster. Though Elisabeth von Bernburg has never returned the love she is forced to leave the school; Manuela gets a severe punishment, like someone who has committed a crime.

Title: The Crawling Eye
Tagline: The nightmare terror of the slithering eye that unleashed agonizing horror on a screaming world!
Overview: Alien creatures invade a remote mountain resort in Switzerland.

Title: Frankenstein 1970
Tagline: The One...The Only KING OF MONSTERS as the new demon of the atomic age!
Overview: The baron's grandson rents the family castle to a TV crew to fund his atomic revival of the family monster.

Title: Cairo Station
Overview: Kinawi, a physically challenged peddler who makes his living selling newspapers in the central Cairo train station, is obsessed by Hannouma, an attractive young woman who sells drinks. While she treats Kinawi in a sympathetic way and jokes with him about a possible relationship, She is actually in love with Abu Sri', a strong and respected porter at the station who is struggling to unionize his fellow workers to combat their boss' exploitative and abusive treatment.

Title: Night of the Blood Beast
Tagline: No girl was safe as long as this head-hunting thing roamed the land!
Overview: An astronaut is killed on re-entry to Earth, but his body is seeded with rapidly-gestating aliens.

Title: Wild Heritage
Overview: Travails of a family heading West in a covered wagon.

Title: Buchanan Rides Alone
Tagline: DOUBLE HANGING -- DOUBLE THRILLS!
Overview: A Texan pits a powerful family against itself to save a Mexican from hanging.

Title: The Naked and the Dead
Overview: Fighting men in World War II learn the value of courage and quickness at the risk of losing their lives.

Title: White Wilderness
Tagline: From The Top Of The World!
Overview: A fabulous new adventure in exciting entertainment.

Title: The Matchmaker
Overview: Thornton Wilder's tale of a matchmaker who desires the man she's supposed to be pairing with another woman.

Title: Tarzan's Fight for Life
Overview: Dr. Sturdy is trying to establish a modern hospital in the jungle. His efforts are strongly opposed by Futa, the witch doctor, and Ramo, a native warrior.

Title: The Hideous Sun Demon
Tagline: The Blaze Of The Sun Made Him A Monster!
Overview: After exposure to radiation, an atomic research scientist finds himself changing into a murderous, lizard-like creature every time he is exposed to sunlight.

Title: The Day the Sky Exploded
Tagline: Terror From The Sky! Earth Attacked From Outer Space!
Overview: Scientists discover that a group of meteors are hurtling on a collison course with Earth, and if they hit, the planet will be destroyed.

Title: The Fountain of Youth
Overview: A short film was directed by Orson Welles, which was based on the short story "Youth from Vienna"

Title: Love Is My Profession
Overview: Married French lawyer Andre defends succesfully the case of Yvette, who committed a robbery. He falls in love with her, but she isn't true to him.

Title: Stolen Desire
Overview: A rumbunctious and ribald tale of a troupe of travelling actors who alternate highlights of kabuki theatre with strip shows.

Title: The Fearmakers
Overview: A Korean War veteran discovers his Washington-based PR firm has been taken over by Communist infiltrators.

Title: I Married a Monster from Outer Space
Tagline: Shuddery things from beyond the stars, here to breed with human women!
Overview: A young bride suspects her husband has been replaced by a space invader.
Original Title: I Married a Monster from Outer Space

Title: The Cheaters
Overview: Bob Letellier, a good looking rich kid who studies science, makes the acquaintance of Alain, a cynical and immoral young man. The latter introduces him to the existentialist circles of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Bob is invited to a party and becomes Clo's lover, a rich heiress.

Title: I Was Monty's Double
Tagline: The Gigantic Hoax of World War II
Overview: The incredible but true story of how an impersonator was recruited to impersonate General Montgomery to mislead the German's about his intentions before the North Africa campaign.

Title: Onionhead
Tagline: The Ship's Cook who has the Coast Guard in a Stew!
Overview: Follow-up to Andy Griffith's big hit in "No Time for Sergeants" moves the action to the Coast Guard and WW II.

Title: The Eternal Rainbow
Overview: Two men at an ironworks encounter roadblocks: the first does not have the grades to get a job, while the other finds himself falling for a co-worker.

Title: Party Girl
Tagline: THE 'MOUTHPIECE': "They're crooked...but the money's good!" MR. BIG: "I run this town...and nobody quits me!" THE PUNK: Never let him get a girl in a corner...
Overview: Slick lawyer Thomas Farrell has made a career of defending mobsters in trials. It's not until he meets a lovely showgirl at a mob party that he realizes that there's more to life then winning trials. Farrell tries to quit the racket, but mob boss Rico Angelo threatens to hurt the showgirl if Farrell leaves him.

Title: The Mugger
Overview: A police shrink tries to identify and capture an elusive mugger that scars his female victims before stealing their purse.

Title: The Horse's Mouth
Overview:
A somewhat vulgar but dedicated painter searches for the perfect realization of his artistic vision, much to the chagrin of others.
 Playing Gulley Jimson, a deceptively scruffy bum, Alec Guinness captures the essence of an artist possessed by the need to create. Guinness' performance and his Oscar -nominated screenplay create both stirring drama and hilarious tomfoolery as the vagrant Jimson races from bar to pawnshop to wealthy art patron to fulfill his artistic quest. Kay Walsh is brilliant as the cantankerous barmaid doomed to help Jimson on his wildest mission yet.

Title: I Want to Live!
Tagline: Barbara Graham's Last Scream From Gas Chamber...
Overview: Barbara Graham is a woman with dubious moral standards, often a guest in seedy bars. She has been sentenced for some petty crimes. Two men she knows murder an older woman. When they get caught they start to think that Barbara has helped the police arresting them. As a revenge they tell the police that Barbara is the murderer.

Title: Floods of Fear
Tagline: A Beauty Marooned With MURDER!
Overview: A man (Howard Keel) framed for murder escapes from prison during a flood and helps a young woman (Anne Heywood) in distress.

Title: Houseboat
Tagline: It All Happens Happily on a Heaven of a Houseboat!
Overview: An Italian socialite on the run signs on as housekeeper for a widower with three children.

Title: Corridors of Blood
Tagline: Tops in Terror!
Overview: An 1840s British surgeon, experiments with anesthetic gases in an effort to make surgery pain-free. While doing so, his demonstration before a panel of his peers ends in a horrific mishap with his patient awakening under the knife; he is forced to leave his position in disgrace. To complicate matters, he becomes addicted to the gases and gets involved with a gang of criminals, led by Black Ben and his henchman Resurrection Joe.

Title: The Lost Missile
Tagline: The thing that came from outer hell ... to burn the world alive!
Overview: Scientists try to stop a mysterious missile from destroying the Earth.

Title: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
Overview: All her life Englishwoman Gladys Aylward knew that China was the place where she belonged. Not qualified to be sent there as a missionary, Gladys works as a domestic to earn the money to send herself to a poor, remote village. There she eventually lives a full and happy life: running the inn, acting as "foot inspector", advising the local Mandarin and even winning the heart of mixed race Captain Lin Nan. But Gladys discovers her real destiny when the country is invaded by Japan and the Chinese children need her to save their lives. Based on a true story.
Original Title: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness

Title: Some Came Running
Tagline: Everyone knew Dave was back in town ... and woman-trouble must be close behind !
Overview: Dave Hirsch, a writer and army veteran, returns to 1948 Parkman, Indiana, his hometown. His prosperous brother introduces him to Gwen French...

Title: The Naked Maja
Tagline: Now she is yours...the matchless...the shameless beauty who lives forever as The Naked Maja!
Overview: A historical fiction based on the lives of artist Goya and the Duchess of Alba

Title: A Walk in the Old City of Warsaw
Mail Early for Xmas
Overview: A Norman McLaren Animation Short Film.

Title: Come Back, Africa
Overview: Come Back, Africa chronicles the life of Zachariah, a black South African living under the rule of the harsh apartheid government in 1959.

Title: Night of the Ghouls
Overview: Phony spiritualist raises the dead.

Title: The Diary of an Unknown Soldier
Overview: A short story narrated by an unknown British soldier who reveals his hopes, fears, and disillusionment while heading into battle against the German army.
Original Title: The Diary of an Unknown Soldier

Title: The Tiger of Eschnapur
Tagline: Der deutsche Millionen-Film!
Overview: In Eschnapur, a German architect saves the life of the Maharajah's favorite temple dancer and becomes Maharajah's friend but their friendship is tested when the architect and the dancer fall in-love, triggering the Maharajah's vengeful ire.

Title: Kaagaz Ke Phool
Overview: The film tells, in flashback, the story of Suresh Sinha (Guru Dutt), a famous film director and his relationship with an aspiring actress.

Title: The Journey
Overview: A Communist officer falls hard for a married woman trying to escape from Hungary.

Title: Forbidden Island
Overview: Divers search for a sunken treasure.

Title: The Giant Behemoth
Tagline: The biggest thing since creation!
Overview: Marine atomic tests cause changes in the ocean's ecosystem resulting in dangerous blobs of radiation and the resurrection of a dormant dinosaur which threatens London.

Title: Prince of Space
Overview: When an alien force tries to invade Earth to steal a powerful new rocket fuel, a mysterious hero intervenes.

Title: The Shaggy Dog
Tagline: "I was a Teen-age boy!"
Overview: Through an ancient spell, a boy changes into a sheepdog and back again. It seems to happen at inopportune times and the spell can only be broken by an act of bravery....

Title: Compulsion
Overview: Two close friends, arrogantly and without remorse, kidnap and murder a young boy. They are caught and put to trial where their larger-than-life defense lawyer blames the Establishment for their actions.

Title: The Monster of Piedras Blancas
Tagline: HE PREYS ON HUMAN FLESH!
Overview: An old lighthouse keeper who lives with his daughter secretly keeps a prehistoric fish-man by feeding it scraps and fish. One day he misses the feeding and all hell breaks loose.

Title: The World of Apu
Overview: Apu is a jobless ex-student dreaming vaguely of a future as a writer. An old college friend talks him into a visit up-country to a village wedding....

Title: The Young Land
Overview: An American gunslinger kills a Mexican man in California immediately after the Mexican-American war. The killer is arrested and put on trial for murder with the Hispanic population waiting to learn of American justice.

Title: Pork Chop Hill
Tagline: Bold! Blunt! Blistering! The battle picture without equal!
Overview: American GI's must retake a barren hill in Korea that has been overrun by Red Chinese troops. The ensuing battle becomes a meat grinder for American and Chinese alike.

Title: The Unforgiven
Tagline: A NEW TRIUMPH FROM ACADEMY AWARD WINNER JOHN HUSTON
Overview: The neighbors of a frontier family turn on them when it is suspected that their adopted daughter was stolen from the local Kiawa tribe.

Title: Teenagers from Outer Space
Tagline: Thrill-crazed space kids blasting the flesh off humans!
Overview: A young alien falls for a pretty teenage Earth girl and they team up to try to stop the plans of his invading cohorts, who intend to use Earth as a food-breeding ground for giant lobsters from their planet.

Title: Blackbird
Overview: A surreal blackbird made of lines is dancing to the music

Title: Hiroshima Mon Amour
Tagline: From the measureless depths of a woman's emotions...
Overview: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

Title: Odd Obsession
Overview: A middle-aged husband of a younger woman finds her youth intimidating to the point that he cannot become aroused. His solution involves the introduction of his daughter's lover to his wife.

Title: Shake Hands with the Devil
Tagline: A story of love and hate...and the sudden sound of guns!
Overview: In 1921 Dublin, the IRA battles the "Black & Tans," special British forces given to harsh measures. Irish-American medical student Kerry O'Shea hopes to stay aloof, but saving a wounded friend gets him outlawed, and inexorably drawn into the rebel organization...under his former professor Sean Lenihan, who has "shaken hands with the devil" and begun to think of fighting as an end in itself. Complications arise when Kerry falls for a beautiful English hostage, and the British offer a peace treaty that is not enough to satisfy Lenihan.

Title: This Earth Is Mine
Overview: Set during the Prohibition era, when wine makers were financially challenged and had to decide whether or not they wanted to cooperate with bootleggers to survive.

Title: Donald in Mathmagic Land
Overview: Disney used animation here to explain through this wonderful adventure of Donald how mathmatics can be usuful in our real life. Through this journey Donald shows us how mathmatics are not just numbers and charts, but magical living things.

Title: Day of the Outlaw
Tagline: Watch what happens to the women... watch the west explode!
Overview: Rival cattlemen join forces to fight off outlaws.

Title: The Ghost of Yotsuya
Overview: The ghost of a samurai's wife takes revenge on her husband.

Title: Don't Give Up the Ship
Tagline: The Funniest Story of High-Seas Hilarity Ever to Set Audiences Adrift in Helpless Hysteria!
Overview: The Navy expects a veteran (Jerry Lewis) to pay for the ship he commanded, as they have no record of its return.

Title: Tarzan's Greatest Adventure
Tagline: Adventure's Mightiest Hero Lives His Mightiest Adventure!
Overview: The greatest adventure of jungle king Tarzan. Four British villains raid a settlement to obtain explosives for use in a diamond mine. In doing so they nearly destroy the settlement, so Tarzan pursues them to their mine.

Title: These Thousand Hills
Tagline: All the fire . . . power . . . drama . . . of A.B. Guthrie's monumental best-seller!
Overview: A cowboy (Don Murray) tries for easy money with his partner, then tries ranching with a saloon hostess's (Lee Remick) money.

Title: Fate of a Man
Overview: The story of a man (Andrey Sokolov) whose life was ruthlessly crippled by World War II. His wife and daughters were killed during the bombing of his village, he spent some time as a prisoner, and his only son was killed in action only a few days before the victory...

Title: It Happened to Jane
Tagline: This movie is bigger than all of us!
Overview: Jane Osgood runs a lobster business, which supports her two young children. Railroad staff inattention ruins her shipment, so with her lawyer George, Jane sues Harry Foster Malone, director of the line and the "meanest man in the world".

Title: Caltiki, the Immortal Monster
Tagline: Slimy Glob of Doom Engulfs The World!
Overview: Academic researchers are chased by a nuclear-hot specimen of ancient Mayan blob.

Title: Face of Fire
Tagline: Who Would Dare Lift the Mask!
Overview: A local handyman saves a child in a fire, but the burns he receives disfigure his face so much that the townspeople avoid him.

Title: But Not For Me
Tagline: It's a scream!
Overview: The Broadway theatre world provides the background for Walter Lang's 1959 comedy about a veteran producer (Clark Gable) falling in love with his twenty-something secretary (Carroll Baker). The cast also includes Lee J. Cobb, Lilli Palmer, Barry Coe, Thomas Gomez and Charles Lane.

Title: The Chasers
Overview: A love triangle of two men who desire the same woman. We follow them through three days of grouse hunting, a chase that ends violently. Or does it?

Title: Araya
Overview: "Araya" is an old natural salt mine located in a peninsula in northeastern Venezuela which was still, by 1959, being exploited manually five hundred years after its discovery by the Spanish. Margot Benacerraf captures in images, the life of the "salineros" and their archaic methods of work before their definite disappearance with the arrival of the industrial exploitation.

Title: Yesterday's Enemy
Tagline: War Is Hell!
Overview: Set during the Burma Campaign of World War 2, this is the story of courage and endurance of the soldiers struggling at close quarters against the enemy. The film examines the moral dilemmas ordinary men face during war, when the definitions of acceptable military action and insupportable brutality become blurred and distorted

Title: That Kind of Woman
Overview: A young GI (Tab Hunter) falls in love with a kept woman (Sophia Loren) on a train to New York.

Title: The Mummy
Tagline: Torn from the tomb to terrify the world!
Overview: One by one the archaeologists who discover the 4,000-year-old tomb of Princess Ananka are brutally murdered. Kharis, high priest in Egypt 40 centuries ago, has been brought to life by the power of the ancient gods and his sole purpose is to destroy those responsible for the desecration of the sacred tomb. But Isobel, wife of one of the explorers, resembles the beautiful princess, forcing the speechless and tormented monster to defy commands and abduct Isobel to an unknown fate.

Title: The Crimson Kimono
Tagline: YES, this beautiful American girl in the arms of a Japanese boy!
Overview: A Los Angeles detective (Glenn Corbett) and his Japanese partner (James Shigeta) woo an artist (Victoria Shaw) while solving a stripper's murder.

Title: All the Boys Are Called Patrick
Overview: Students Veronique and Charlotte meet the same man separately, who makes a date with each of them separately the next evening. When they both show up, he shows up, too, with a third woman.
Original Title: Charlotte et Véronique, ou Tous les garçons s'appellent Patrick

Title: The Best of Everything
Tagline: The Female Jungle EXPOSED!
Overview: An expose of the lives and loves of Madison Avenue working girls and their higher ups.

Title: Odds Against Tomorrow
Tagline: He knew where $50,000 lay begging to be STOLEN!
Overview: An old-time crook plans a heist. When one of his two partners is found out to be a black man tensions flare.

Title: Two Men in Manhattan
Overview: Two French journalists become embroiled in a criminal plot in New York City involving a disappeared United Nations diplomat.

Title: The Great War
Overview: Italy, 1916. Oreste Jacovacci and Giovanni Busacca are called, as all the Italian youths, to serve the army in the WWI. They both try in every way to avoid serving the army.

Title: Sogno di una notte di mezza sbornia
Original Title: Sogno di una notte di mezza sbornia

Title: Terror Is a Man
Tagline: For People With NERVES Of Iron Only!
Overview: A mad scientist transforms a panther into a man-like creature that escapes and goes on a murderous rampage.

Title: Battle of the Coral Sea
Overview: A US submarine and its crew are captured by the Japanese on the eve of a major WWII battle.

Title: Pull My Daisy
Overview: Pull My Daisy is a film that typifies the Beat Generation. Directed by Robert Frank and Alfred Leslie, Daisy was adapted by Jack Kerouac from the third act of his play, Beat Generation; Kerouac also provided improvised narration.

Title: Το Ξύλο Βγήκε Από Τον Παράδεισο
Original Title: Το Ξύλο Βγήκε Από Τον Παράδεισο

Title: Samurai Vendetta
Overview: Two amiable samurai wind up on opposite sides of the vendetta between Lord Asano's retainers and the family of Lord Kira that led to the famous revenge of the 47 Ronin.

Title: Am Tag, als der Regen kam
Overview: Motorcylce driving kids in pre-war Germany commit crime at night.
Original Title: Am Tag, als der Regen kam

Title: Santa Claus
Tagline: Better Than a Visit from Saint Nick Himself!
Overview: Pitch, the mean-spirited devil, is trying to ruin Christmas. Santa Claus teams up with Merlin the Magician and the children of the world in order to save the day!

Title: Ballad of a Soldier
Overview: During World War II, 19 year old soldier Alyosha gets a medal as a reward for a heroic act at the front. Instead of this medal he asks for a few days leave to visit his mother and repair the roof of their home. On the train eastwards he meets Shura who is on her way to her aunt. In those few days traveling together they fall in love.

Title: Gangster Story
Tagline: Filmed where it actually happened... The true story of Jack Martin
Overview: Actor Walter Matthau directed his first and only feature film with the black-and-white crime drama Gangster Story. In an unusual noncomedic role, Matthau plays Jack Martin, a local gangster who wants to run his own crime syndicate in the neighborhood run by Earl Dawson (Bruce McFarlan). They eventually team up and plan a heist. Carol Grace plays the reform-minded girlfriend.

Title: The Giant of Marathon
Overview: A Greek soldier leads the fight against an invading Persian army.

Title: Never So Few
Tagline: Kiss by kiss the time ran out and never so few were the moments left for love!
Overview: A U.S. military troop takes command of a band of Burmese guerillas during World War II.

Title: Pickpocket
Overview: Michel is released from jail after serving a sentence for thievery. His mother dies and he resorts to pickpocketing as a means of survival.

Title: Jungle Cat
Overview: This final True-Life Adventure would also appear to be one of the best, as we go into the South American jungle to observe the jaguar. Jungle Cat is more intimate than its kin, allowing individual animal characters to be developed. Central to the cast is a pair of jaguars (one ebony), whose fighting leads to love and, not long after, two babies (one resembling each parent).

Title: The Purple Gang
Tagline: When machine gun mania rocked the nation!
Overview: The story of the infamous Purple Gang - a ring of bootleggers, hijackers and killers in 1920's Detroit.

Title: Fiasco in Milan
Overview: The usual gang of robbers in engaged by a thief from Milan to steal a suitcase full of money, but troubles will menace the success of the operation.

Title: Suddenly, Last Summer
Tagline: Suddenly, last summer, Cathy knew she was being used for something evil!
Overview: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

Title: Magic Boy
Overview: A young Japanese boy climbs a mountain in search of a magic wizard. The youth finds the wizard, and is tutored by him. Reinforced with magic powers, the boy eventually fights, and defeats the evil witches of down under.

Title: Battle in Outer Space
Tagline: SPACE DECLARES WAR ON EARTH - OUTLAW PLANET CAPTURES THE MOON!
Overview: The nations of the Earth unite in a common cause to fight off an invader from outer space.

Title: Oko Wykol
Overview: Early silent short film by Jerzy Skolimowski.

Title: The Beatniks
Tagline: The wild, weird world of the Beatniks!...Sullen rebels, defiant chicks...searching for a life of their own! The pads...the jazz...the dives...those frantic "way-out" parties...beyond belief!
Overview: A young singer's chance at fame is threatened by his hoodlum pals.

Title: Monkey's Teeth
Overview: Monkey's Teeth, a slow and ugly fairy tale based on the drawings of inmates at a psychiatric clinic where LaLoux worked.

Title: Peter Pan
Overview: In this magical tale about the boy who refuses to grow up, Peter Pan and his mischievous fairy sidekick Tinkerbell visit the nursery of Wendy, Michael and John Darling. With a sprinkling of pixie dust, Peter and his new friends fly out the nursery window and over London to Never-Never Land. The children experience many wonderful and exciting adventures with the Lost Boys, Tiger Lily's Indian tribe, and Peter's arch enemy the dastardly pirate Captain Hook.

Title: Mughal-e-Azam
Overview: Set in the 16th century AD, the movie brings to life the tale of the doomed love affair between the Mughal Crown Prince Saleem and the beautiful, ill-fated court dancer, whose fervor and intensity perpetrates a war between the prince and his father the great Mughal Emperor Akbar, and threatens to bring an empire to its knees.

Title: Eyes Without a Face
Overview: Professor Genessier is guilt-stricken after his daughter's face is disfigured in a car accident. He intends to rebuild his daughter's face via grafting skin tissue; he only needs a supply of donors to experiment on.

Title: Private Property
Tagline: The boldest story of a planned seduction ever to scald the screen!
Overview: A hoodlum (Corey Allen) plots to seduce a lonely housewife (Kate Manx) and turn her over to his virginal friend (Warren Oates).

Title: The Amazing Transparent Man
Tagline: Invisible and Deadly!
Overview: An ex-major forces a scientist to develop a invisibility formula, with which he plans to create an invisible army and sell it to the highest bidder. However there are side effects to the formula.

Title: The Flesh and the Fiends
Tagline: Coffins Looted! Cadavers Dissected!
Overview: Edinburgh surgeon Dr. Robert Knox requires cadavers for his research into the functioning of the human body; local ne'er-do-wells Burke and Hare find ways to provide him with fresh specimens...

Title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
Tagline: The Wildest Mobster of the Roaring Twenties!
Overview: The New York killer (Ray Danton) goes from mob bodyguard to mob boss to mob target.
Original Title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond

Title: The Virgin Spring
Overview: A harrowing tale of faith, revenge, and savagery in medieval Sweden.

Title: Ocean's Eleven
Tagline: In any other town they'd be the bad guys...
Overview: Ocean's Eleven is the 'Rat-Pack' comedy about robber Danny Ocean and his gang's attempt to rob the five biggest casinos in Las Vegas.

Title: The Hypnotic Eye
Tagline: BEWARE HIS HYPNOTIC POWER that turns human flesh into helpless robots!
Overview: A stage hypnotist's (Jacques Bergerac) ugly helper (Allison Hayes) suggests terrible things to spellbound beauties.

Title: Comanche Station
Tagline: The One-Man War Against The Comancheros!
Overview: A man saves a woman who had been kidnapped by Comanches, then struggles to get both of them home alive.

Title: The Angry Silence
Tagline: Rough, Tough, Deeply Moving
Overview: A young factory worker stands alone against a proposed strike.

Title: Seven Thieves
Tagline: The robbery that rocked Monte Carlo!
Overview: A discredited professor and a sophisticated thief decide to join together and pick a team to pull off one last job--the casino vault in Monte Carlo.

Title: Breathless
Tagline: The film that was banned for 4 years. Why..?
Overview: A young car thief kills a policeman and tries to persuade a girl to hide in Italy with him.

Title: Le Trou
Tagline: The greatest film about prison life
Overview: An imprisoned man, awaiting trial for the attempted murder of his wife, is transferred to another cell, where his fellow prisoners are planning a jailbreak. He decides to go along with the elaborate plan, and the cellmates attempt to tunnel their way to freedom. Le Trou represents the last film of director Jacques Becker, who died shortly after its completion.

Title: Vacations in Majorca
Overview: Ugly, persistent, and (initially) annoying admirer pursues a beautiful actress. At first he is laughed of, especially by his ultra handsome rival, but with his firm insistence, and gradually emerging charm, he seduces the lady, to the total shocked surprise of his rival.
Original Title: Brevi amori a Palma di Majorca

Title: Tall Story
Tagline: SUCH FUN! That college girl who can't help lovin' tall boys!...
Overview: Love puts a college basketball star into a tailspin.

Title: The Boy and the Pirates
Tagline: Boy Against Buccaneer!
Overview: Young boy is magically transported back in time to a pirate ship on the high seas. Jimmy desires to be a pirate when one day he discovers a magic bottle on the beach. He makes a wish and suddenly finds himself aboard Blackbeard's ship. Soon he realizes that being a pirate isn't what he expected.

Title: Macario
Tagline: Macabre, haunting and wonderful
Overview: Poor, hungry peasant Macario longs for just one good meal on the Day of the Dead. After his wife cooks a turkey for him, he meets three apparitions, the Devil, God, and Death. Each asks him to share his turkey, but he refuses all except Death. In return, Death gives him a bottle of water which will heal any illness. Soon, Macario is more wealthy than the village doctor, which draws the attention of the feared Inquisition

Title: L'Avventura
Tagline: A new adventure in filmmaking...
Overview: A woman disappears during a Mediterranean boating trip. During the search for the woman, her lover and her best friend become attracted to each other.

Title: Psycho
Tagline: The master of suspense moves his cameras into the icy blackness of the unexplored!
Overview: When larcenous real estate clerk Marion Crane goes on the lam with a wad of cash and hopes of starting a new life, she ends up at the notorious Bates Motel, where manager Norman Bates cares for his housebound mother. The place seems quirky, but fine… until Marion decides to take a shower.

Title: Good-for-Nothing
Overview: Yoshida's first feature follows the lives of young students against a background of jazz, emptiness and boredom. The plot is fairly simple: a "good-for-nothing" from a poor background falls in love with the young secretary of his rich friend's father. The woman senses good in him and tries to lead him on the right path.

Title: The Body
Overview: A beautiful woman who lives on an island with her abusive husband, entices a young man into a murder-for-money plot.

Title: The Rat Race
Overview: Tender romantic comedy about an aspiring musician who arrives in New York in search of fame & fortune. He soon meets a taxi dancer, moves in with her, and before too long a romance develops.

Title: The Lost World
Tagline: In the middle of the twentieth century, you fall off the brink of time!
Overview: Professor Challenger leads an expedition of scientists and adventurers to a remote plateau deep in the Amazonian jungle to verify his claim that dinosaurs still live there.

Title: The Bellboy
Tagline: It's a Series of Silly Sequences and One of Jerry's All-Time Great Comedy Performances!
Overview: Stanley is a bellboy at the Fountainbleau Hotel in Miami Beach. It is there that he performs his duties quietly and without a word to anyone. All that he displays are facial expressions and a comedic slapstick style. And anything that can go wrong - does go wrong when Stanley is involved. Then one day, Jerry Lewis, big star, arrives at the hotel and some of the staff notice the striking resemblanc

Title: Portrait in Black
Tagline: They touched...and an evil spark was struck!
Overview: A pair of lovers plot to kill the woman's rich husband.

Title: Pay or Die!
Overview: A beautifully rendered, fact-based crime film about a crusading Italian policeman battling Black Hand extortionists in New York’s Little Italy is back on the big screen. In addition to Ernest Borgnine’s brilliantly sensitive portrayal as Lieutenant Joseph Petrosino, this engrossing picture is deftly photographed by Lucien Ballard, beautifully scored by David Raksin with a stellar supporting cast including Zohra Lampert and Alan Austin. Literate, suspenseful and emotionally moving, this memorable film remains the definitive depiction about the emergence of the Mafia in America.

Title: Dinosaurus!
Overview: After undersea explosions near a Caribbean island, prehistoric creatures are unleashed on the unsuspecting population.

Title: Song Without End
Overview: The romantic story of Hungarian pianist Franz Liszt (Dirk Bogarde), whose scandalous love affair forced him to abandon his adoring audiences.

Title: Beat Girl
Tagline: "My mother was a stripper... I want to be a stripper too!"
Overview: A British architect's (David Farrar) daughter spites her French stepmother (Noëlle Adam) by hanging out with Soho beatniks.

Title: The Warrior Empress
Tagline: She stormed the battlements of love and war!
Overview: The poetess Sappho led an uprising against the corrupt government of the island of Lesbos.

Title: All the Young Men
Tagline: Spit out what's on your filthy little mind ... and then take your orders from me !
Overview: During the Korean War, the lieutenant in charge of a Marine rifle platoon is killed in battle. Before he dies, he places the platoon's sergeant, who's black, in charge. The sergeant figures on having trouble with two men in his platoon: a private who has much more combat experience than he does, and a racist Southerner who doesn't like blacks in the first place and has no intention of taking orders from one. Written by frankfob2@yahoo.com

Title: Madalena
Overview: Madalena (Aliki Vouyoukiaki) is a tough seventeen-year-old who is forced to take on her father's ferry business after he dies. She has her many brothers and sisters to support, and there is no one else to do the job (her mother has also died). So she rallies her defenses and sets out to give her rival in the ferry business a run for his money. But at the same time, the rival's handsome son (Dimitris Papamichael) is starting to look better and better. Madalena refuses to acknowledge her feelings for him -- though how long she can sustain that denial is the question.

Title: The Little Shop of Horrors
Tagline: The funniest picture of the year!
Overview: Black comedy about a young man who creates a carnivorous plant and must kill in order to feed it.

Title: All The Fine Young Cannibals
Overview: Director Michael Anderson's glossy 1960 drama, about the professional and romantic problems of an aspiring jazz musician, stars Robert Wagner, Natalie Wood, Susan Kohner, George Hamilton, Pearl Bailey, Anne Seymour, Jack Mullaney, Onslow Stevens, Virginia Gregg, Mabel Albertson, Louise Beavers and Addison Richards.

Title: High Time
Tagline: Here's how to guarantee a high time!
Overview: Despite the dissapproval of his grown son and daughter, 51 year old widdower and wealthy restauranteur Harvey Howard (Bing Crosby) decides it's 'high time' to he gets his college degree.  And he's in for the full ride: living in the dorms, joing a fraternity, falling in love, and even getting some studying in.

Title: Tormented
Tagline: A ghost-woman owned him body and soul!
Overview: A jazz pianist (Richard Carlson) is haunted by his dead ex-lover's (Juli Reding) crawling hand and floating head.

Title: Love and the Frenchwoman
Overview: The seven stages in the life of the modern Frenchwomen are disclosed by seven directors in a witty way: 1 - Childhood, 2 - Adolescence, 3 - Virginity, 4 - Marriage, 5 - Adultery, 6 - Divorce, 7 - The Single Woman.

Title: Faust
Overview: In 1957 Gustaf Gründgens staged a new production of Goethe's Faust in which he once again played Mephisto, a part he had played since 1932. The brilliant production was a huge success and ran for a couple of years. In 1959 Peter Gorski captured the performance on film in his directorial film debut. Basically it is a registration of the production, but Gorksi did manage to accentuate the details of the acting by using enough medium and close-up shots which give a view on the acting you normally would not able to see in a theater.

Title: Midnight Lace
Tagline: Even with the arms of her love around her...she still felt the menace of that voice in the night!
Overview: This 1960 thriller, set in London, stars Doris Day as a wife who begins to unravel when she receives threatening telephone calls informing her she's soon to be murdered.

Title: The Devil's Eye
Overview: The devil has a stye in his eye, caused by the purity of a vicar's daughter. To get rid of it, he sends Don Juan up from hell to seduce the 20 year old Britt-Marie and to rob her of her virginity and her belief in love. She however can resist him and things get even turned around when Don Juan falls in love with her. The fact that he feels love for the first time now, makes him even less attractive to her and Don Juan returns to hell.

Title: The River Fuefuki
Overview: When the youngest members of a family of farmers decide to become warriors, the clan's troubles multiply.

Title: My Bakery in Brooklyn
Overview: Two young women do their best to try and save their dead aunt's bakery

Title: Shoot the Piano Player
Tagline: A Film for Adults
Overview: Charlie Kohler is a piano player in a bar. The waitress Lena is in love with him. One of Charlie's brother, Chico, a crook, takes refuge in the bar because he is chased by two gangsters, Momo and Ernest. We will discover that Charlie's real name is Edouard Saroyan, once a virtuose who gives up after his wife's suicide. Charlie now has to deal wih Chico, Ernest, Momo, Fido (his youngest brother who lives with him), and Lena...

Title: The Magnificent Seven
Tagline: They were seven - And they fought like seven hundred!
Overview: An oppressed Mexican peasant village hires seven gunfighters to help defend their homes.

Title: A Circle of Deception
Overview: Unbeknownst to him, a soldier is sent on a doomed mission because of the high likelihood of him divulging secrets if captured and tortured.

Title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
Tagline: Ripped Raw and Roaring from Real Life!
Overview: In this sequel to "Knock On Any Door", the residents of a Chicago tenement building band together to insure that the son of Nick Romano does not follow in his father's footsteps...to the electric chair.
Original Title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph

Title: The Facts of Life
Overview: Two romantic couples are each married to different people! They really DO love each other. At the beginning Kitty thinks Larry is un-funny...

Title: G.I. Blues
Tagline: Elvis scores... A Singing Triumph... And A Romantic Hit!
Overview: In Frankfurt, the G.I. Tulsa McLean (Elvis Presley) bets all the money his friends Cookie (Robert Ivers) and Rick (James Douglas) and he are saving to buy a night-club of their own in USA that his mate Dynamite will seduce and spend a night with the untouchable cabaret dancer Lili (Juliet Prowse). When Dynamite is transferred to Alaska, Tulsa has to replace him in the bet.

Title: Letters of a Novice
Overview: The nun tells the priest about her past and then a long flashback begins...

Title: Cimarron
Tagline: The Story Of A Man, A Land and A Love!
Overview: The epic story of a family that's involved in the Oklahoma Land Rush in 1889.

Title: Innocent Sorcerers
Overview: A young doctor is tired of being sought by women. One night he meets a young girl who all but forces herself into his room where they talk of morals and love. But he loses her when he goes out to see some friends and then rushes madly around the city after her.

Title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
Tagline: All-New Adventures of Robin Hood! The world's most fearless fighter faces his greatest challenge!
Overview: Robin of Loxley and his men stumble on a plot to overthrow Hubert Walter, King's Chancellor and Archbishop of Canterbury. The plotters, the Sheriff of Nottingham and the Earl of Newark, have set an ambush for Walter and Lady Marian Fitzwater. Will Robin get to them before it is too late?

Title: Where the Boys Are
Tagline: The hilarious inside story of those rip-roaring spring vacations!
Overview: Good girls Merritt, Melanie, Tuggle and Angie - all students at mid-western Penmore University - are planning on going to Fort Lauderdale, Florida for spring break to get away from the mid-western snow despite not having much money to spend once there. On the drive down, they admit their real purpose is to go where the boys are.

Title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
Tagline: You'll crack your timbers when you see how the Navy sticks the Army sad sacks with the crumbiest ship afloat!
Overview: Lieutenant Rip Crandall is hoodwinked into taking command of the "Wackiest Ship in the Navy" - a real garbage scow with a crew of misfits who don't know a jib from a jigger. What none of them knows, including Crandall, is that this ship has a very important top-secret mission to complete in waters patrolled by the Japanese fleet. Their mission will save hundreds of allied lives - if only they can get there in one piece.
Original Title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army

Title: Arnulf Rainer
Overview: An experimental film, the last in Peter Kubelka's trilogy of “metric films”. Each frame of Arnulf Rainer is composed of darkness or light and silence or sound.

Title: Invasion of the Neptune Men
Overview: Clumsy invaders from Neptune are thwarted by hero Space Chief and a nondescript group of microshort-wearing Japanese kids.

Title: Payroll
Tagline: Brilliant... Brutal... Torn from tonight's headlines!
Overview: A vicious gang of crooks plan to steal the wages of a local factory, but their carefully laid plans go wrong, when the factory employs an armoured van to carry the cash. The gang still go ahead with the robbery, but when the driver of the armoured van is killed in the raid, his wife plans revenge, and with the police closing in, the gang start to turn on each other.

Title: Konga
Tagline: Not since "King Kong"...has the screen exploded with such mighty fury and spectacle!
Overview: Dr.Decker comes back from Africa after a year, presumed dead. During that year, he came across a way of growing plants and animals to an enormous size. He brings back a baby chimpanzee to test out his theory. As he has many enemies at home, he decides to use his chimp, 'Konga' to 'get rid of them'. Then Konga grows to gigantic proportions and reaks havoc all over the city of London!!

Title: The Misfits
Tagline: It shouts and sings with life ... explodes with love!
Overview: While filing for a divorce, beautiful ex-stripper Roslyn Taber ends up meeting aging cowboy-turned-gambler Gay Langland and former World War II aviator Guido Racanelli. The two men instantly become infatuated with Roslyn and, on a whim, the three decide to move into Guido's half-finished desert home together. When grizzled ex-rodeo rider Perce Howland arrives, the unlikely foursome strike up a business capturing wild horses.

Title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians
Tagline: The Canine Caper of the Century
Overview: When a litter of dalmatian puppies are abducted by the minions of Cruella De Vil, the parents must find them before she uses them for a diabolical fashion statement.

Title: God's Own Country
Overview: A Yorkshire farmer develops a relationship with a Romanian migrant worker.

Title: Gorgo
Tagline: Like nothing you've ever seen before!
Overview: Never take a baby from his mother. You'll see why in this action-packed monster thriller as young Gorgo, a creature from the sea, is relocated to London from Ireland, with rampaging mommy-dearest not far behind.

Title: Alice in the Navy
Overview: Aliki is in love with someone who serves his duty in the greek navy. Wanting to see him, she disguises as a navy soldier and gets aboard her lover's ship. Things get more complicated when she comes accross the ship's captain; her father!

Title: The Counterfeiters of Paris
Overview: A rich, old counterfeiter is lured out of retirement.

Title: The Wizard of Baghdad
Tagline: ENTER A WORLD OF 1001 THRILLS!
Overview: A genie turned mortal after his many failures is sent to Baghdad. As his last chance to prove himself he must help a prince and princess fulfill a prophecy.

Title: Totò, Peppino and... the Sweet Life
Overview: Antonio goes to Rome to represent his fellow peasants, to request a highway that will be built in their region. But the guy is mastered by 'la dolce vita' and wastes the money entrusted to him for his mission. When Peppino is sent to to find out what happened, he lets himself be trapped by the gentle grip of 'la dolce vita'
Original Title: Totò, Peppino e la Dolce Vita

Title: Return to Peyton Place
Overview: More hubub in the little town full of secrets when a visiting author trys to pry loose some juicy scandals!

Title: Taxi for Tobruk
Tagline: The most exciting, explosive journey the screen has ever taken through a minefield of human emotions.
Overview: During World War II, French Commandos join forces with a German officer in order to survive the African desert.

Title: The Joy of Living
Overview: Ulisse is a naive young man out looking for a job after being released from the army. He drops the offer he gets from a group of fascists to go in with the Fossatis, a family of anarchists (unknown to him).

Title: Mad Dog Coll
Overview: Killer Vincent "Mad Dog" Coll moves in on gangster Dutch Schultz in 1920s New York.

Title: The Long Absence
Overview: The Long Absence (French: Une aussi longue absence) is a 1961 French film directed by Henri Colpi. It tells the story of Therese (Alida Valli), a café owner mourning the mysterious disappearance of her husband sixteen years earlier. A tramp arrives in the town and she believes him to be her husband. But he is suffering from amnesia and she tries to bring back his memory of earlier times.

Title: Viridiana
Tagline: We've got nothing to hide
Overview: Viridiana, a young nun about to take her final vows, pays a visit to her widowed uncle at the request of her Mother Superior.

Title: Last Year at Marienbad
Tagline: Evocative, compelling, fascinating, different - an important motion picture, an exceptional work of art from the brilliant Alain Resnais
Overview: Takes place in a chateau, an ambiguous story of a man and a woman who may or may not have met last year at Marienbad.

Title: Creature from the Haunted Sea
Tagline: This Gangster's "Single Partner" Isn't Even Human!
Overview: A crook decides to bump off members of his inept crew and blame their deaths on a legendary sea creature. What he doesn't know is that the creature is real.

Title: Taste of Fear
Tagline: For maximum thrill . . . we earnestly urge you to see this motion picture from the start!
Overview: A wheelchair-bound young girl returns to her father's estate after ten years, and although she's told he's away, she keeps seeing his dead body on the estate.

Title: But What If This Is Love?
Overview: High school students Ksenya and Boris are in love but all the world id against them. Could they fight it and will the first love win?

Title: The Mark
Tagline: A film which doesn't 'protect' you from the truth!
Overview: A man who served prison time for intent to molest a child tries to build a new life with the help of a sympathetic psychiatrist.

Title: King of the Roaring 20's: The Story of Arnold Rothstein
Tagline: The hell-bent, jazz-crazed era and the man who ruled it all!
Overview: Gambler Arnold Rothstein (David Janssen) marries an actress (Dianne Foster), avenges his buddy (Mickey Rooney) and meets an underworld fate.
Original Title: King of the Roaring 20's: The Story of Arnold Rothstein

Title: La viaccia
Tagline: A woman's touch becomes a man's obsession
Overview: The death of a wealthy patriarch in 1885 sets off an interfamily power struggle.

Title: Wild in the Country
Tagline: It's all about young people and their growing pains!
Overview: A troubled young man discovers that he has a knack for writing when a counselor encourages him to pursue a literary career.

Title: Two Loves
Tagline: So busy with her children...SHE DIDN'T HAVE TIME TO GET MARRIED!
Overview: An American spinster who takes a job teaching Maori students in New Zealand finds unexpected romance with two men.

Title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
Tagline: From Hundred of Miles In Outer Space to Seven Miles Beneath the Sea!
Overview: The crew of an atomic submarine battle to save the world from global destruction.
Original Title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea

Title: The Exiles
Overview: Native Americans in Los Angeles. For 12 hours one Friday night, from late afternoon until dawn, we follow a handful of urban Indians. Yvonne is pregnant, commenting on her life and dreams as she shops, walks home, cooks dinner, and watches her husband Homer leave with his friends. Homer and his pals go bar hopping, play some poker, and end up, bottles in hand, with other Indians on a hilltop. During the night, the men pick up women, there are fights, there's camaraderie, and Homer reflects on life in the city versus life on the reservation. At dawn, Yvonne watches Hector from a window as he and two pals and two women head somewhere. "Let's do it again tonight," says one.

Title: Greyfriars Bobby: The True Story of a Dog
Tagline: The true story of a dog
Overview: In Scotland 1865, An old shepherd and his little Skye terrier go to Edinburgh. But when the shepherd dies of pneumonia, the dog remains faithful to his master, refuses to be adopted by anyone, and takes to sleeping on his master's grave in the Greyfriars kirkyard, despite a caretaker with a "no dogs" rule. And when Bobby is taken up for being unlicensed, it's up to the children of Edinburgh and the Lord Provost to decide what's to be done.
Original Title: Greyfriars Bobby: The True Story of a Dog

Title: Two Rode Together
Tagline: TOGETHER...THEY RODE INTO A THOUSAND DANGERS!
Overview: Two tough westerners bring home a group of settlers who have spent years as Comanche hostages.

Title: Tammy Tell Me True
Overview: Tammy leaves the river in Mississippi to attend college, developing a relationship with Tom Freeman (John Gavin). Sandra Dee replaces Debbie Reynolds in this and the third Tammy movie. This film introduces both a new theme song, "Tammy Tell Me True", and the character of Mrs. Annie Call, played by veteran Beulah Bondi. Mrs. Call ultimately moves in with Tammy at the Ellen B. and would be the catalyst for the events in the following film, "Tammy and The Doctor".

Title: Night Tide
Tagline: Temptress from the sea… loving… killing!
Overview: On leave in a shore side town, Johnny becomes interested in a young dark haired woman

Title: Drei Mann in einem Boot
Overview: No overview found.

Title: My Mother and Her Guest
Overview: A single mother takes on a boarder, with intriguing results.

Title: A Woman Is a Woman
Overview: Exotic dancer Angéla attempts to have a child with her unwilling lover Émile. In the process, she finds herself torn between him and his best friend Alfred.

Title: Il Posto
Overview: Domenico and Antonietta are two suburban Italian youths who meet while seeking "a job for life" from a big city corporation.

Title: Bridge to the Sun
Tagline: Their love was a bridge between two worlds!
Overview: Tells the true story of Gwen Terasaki, who falls in love with, then marries a Japanese diplomat. When war breaks out they find animosity and trouble from both sides.

Title: El Cid
Tagline: The GREATEST ROMANCE and ADVENTURE in a THOUSAND YEARS!
Overview: Epic film of the legendary Spanish hero, Rodrigo Diaz ("El Cid" to his followers), who, without compromising his strict sense of honour, still succeeds in taking the initiative and driving the Moors from Spain.

Title: The Best of Enemies
Tagline: One of the great comedies of all time!
Overview: During World War II, a plane full of RAF fighter crashes in the Ethiopian desert and they are met upon by an enemy Italian patrol that allows them to go free. But, when the Brits are given orders to attack the Italians, lots of problems ensue.

Title: The End of Summer
Overview: The Kohayakawa family is thrown into distress when childlike father Manbei takes up with his old mistress, in one of Ozu’s most deftly modulated blendings of comedy and tragedy.

Title: The Power and the Glory
Tagline: Out of Graham Greene's novel that made the world gasp--the drama of a priest who somehow stumbled onto the road to martyrdom
Overview: Based on Graham Greene's novel about a flawed but devoted priest in 1930s Mexico who attempts to perform his duties while eluding a police lieutenant determined to capture him.

Title: The Day the Earth Caught Fire
Tagline: The INCREDIBLE becomes Real! The IMPOSSIBLE becomes Fact! The UNBELIEVABLE becomes True!
Overview: British reporters suspect an international cover-up of a global disaster in progress... and they're right. Hysterical panic has engulfed the world after the United States and the Soviet Union simultaneously detonate nuclear devices and have caused the orbit of the Earth to alter, sending it hurtling towards the sun.
Original Title: The Day the Earth Caught Fire

Title: Too Late Blues
Tagline: The Bold Story Of A Man Caught Between Two Strange Loves!
Overview: Ghost is an idealogical musician who would rather play his blues in the park to the birds than compromise himself.

Title: Der Herr Karl
Overview: No overview found.

Title: Paris Belongs to Us
Overview: A young woman joins a theatrical troupe where she slowly believes that the director is involved with a secret group and that he is in grave danger.

Title: The Phantom Planet
Tagline: It Begins Where Others End! On the Moon!
Overview: After an invisible asteroid draws an astronaut and his ship to its surface, he is miniaturized by the phantom planet's exotic atmosphere.

Title: Snow White and the Three Stooges
Overview: Once upon a time, in the kingdom of Fortunia, a noble king and his lovely young queen lack but one blessing to make their joy complete. The queen gives birth to a daughter named Snow White, but dies soon after. The king mourns her, but in time, he remarries because of the pleading of his people. His new queen is a beautiful, but evil woman who soon becomes jealous of Snow White's beauty.
Original Title: Snow White and the Three Stooges

Title: Waltz of the Toreadors
Overview: General Fitzhugh, an ageing Lothario has an over-active eye for a pretty woman. Despite a long and satisfying career as a seducer extraordinaire, something always seems to get in the way of his bedding the breathtakingly lovely Ghislaine, a more-than-willing town local.

Title: Lines: Horizontal
Overview: Horizontal lines move to different rhythms over backgrounds of different colors while music plays.  -Edgar Cochran

Title: Crosstrap
Overview: In this thriller, two gangs of jewel thieves battle it out in a deserted cottage. Murder ensues when the owners of the cabin show up. Listed as lost by the BFI.

Title: Sanjuro
Tagline: Akira Kurosawa's Powerful and Newest Japanese Masterpiece
Overview: Toshiro Mifune swaggers and snarls to brilliant comic effect in Kurosawa's tightly paced, beautifully composed "Sanjuro." In this companion piece and sequel to "Yojimbo," jaded samurai Sanjuro helps an idealistic group of young warriors weed out their clan's evil influences, and in the process turns their image of a proper samurai on its ear.

Title: Five Weeks in a Balloon
